Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 03:20PM LivingLifeNow wrote: Melissa, Sorry to hear that youÂ are having such a rough time. I was never on chemo, so can't help you there. I was told by my ONC that if I did have chemo, I would go through menopause--but then I was 48 at the time. With you being so young, that might be the difference. However, any period that lasts that long should be checked out. Good luck! Hope there are others out there that can give you more advice than I have. Pam

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2011 02:49PM LivingLifeNow wrote: Most of my tattoos were quite small, but I did have one large one--right between my breasts. My plastic surgeon said he would remove it when he did the implant exchange. No more blue ink, just a small skin-colored dent. I will be sure to let anyone who might need to know that the "dent" is a radiation tattoo in disguise!
